title-group.article-title: Using Number Fields to Compute Logarithms in Finite Fields

abstract.p: We describe an adaptation of the number field sieve to the problem of computing logarithms in a finite field. We conjecture that the running time of the algorithm, when restricted to finite fields of an arbitrary but fixed degree, is L<sub>q</sub>[1/3; (64/9)<sup>1/3</sup> + o(1)], where q is the cardinality of the field, L<sub>q</sub>[s;c] = exp(c(log q)<sup>s</sup>(log log q)<sup>1-s</sup>), and the o(1) is for q → ∞. The number field sieve factoring algorithm is conjectured to factor a number the size of q in the same amount of time.
